tool.name: Cluster
tool.description: Assign sequences to OTUs (Operational Taxonomic Unit)
tool.command:
echo "cluster( #if $matrix.format == "phylip": phylip="$matrix.dist", #else column="$matrix.dist", #end if #if $matrix.name: name="$matrix.name", #end if #if $count: count="$count", #end if hard="$hard", #if float($cutoff) > 0.0: cutoff="$cutoff", #end if precision="$precision", sim="$sim", method="$method" )" | sed 's/ //g' ## mothur trips over whitespace | mothur;
## move output files to correct destination prefix="$matrix.dist"; mv mothur.*.logfile "$logfile"; mv \${prefix%.dat}*.rabund "$rabund"; mv \${prefix%.dat}*.sabund "$sabund"; mv \${prefix%.dat}*.list "$otulist";

param.name: cutoff
param.label: cutoff - Distance Cutoff threshold - ignored if not > 0.0
param.help: Ignore pairwise distances larger than this, a common value would be 0.10

param.name: hard
param.label: hard - Use hard cutoff instead of rounding

param.name: precision
param.label: precision - Precision for rounding distance values
param.help: Set higher precision for longer genome scale sequence lengths

param.name: sim
param.label: sim - Matrix values are Similary instead of Distance

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The cluster_ command assign sequences to OTUs (Operational Taxonomy Unit). The assignment is based on a phylip-formatted_distance_matrix_ or a column-formatted_distance_matrix_ and name_ file. It generates a list_, a sabund_ (Species Abundance), and a rabund_ (Relative Abundance) file.
.. _phylip-formatted_distance_matrix: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Phylip-formatted_distance_matrix .. _column-formatted_distance_matrix: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Column-formatted_distance_matrix .. _name: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Name_file .. _list: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/List_file .. _rabund: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Rabund_file .. _sabund: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Sabund_file .. _cluster: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Cluster
